intro: Cyathochaeta stipoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Cyathochaeta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It features slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Cyathochaeta stipoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
